00069 static const char Usage[] =
00070 "\n"
00071 "\n"
00072 "Usage: orcaroot_ipe_katrin [options] [input file(s) / socket host:port]\n"
00073 "\n"
00074 "The one required argument is either the name of a file to be processed or\n"
00075 "a host and port of a socket from which to read data. For a file, you may\n"
00076 "enter a series of files to be processed, or use a wildcard like \"file*.dat\"\n"
00077 "For a socket, the argument should be formatted as host:port.\n"
00078 "\n"
00079 "Available options:\n"
00080 "  --help : print this message and exit\n"
00081 "  --verbosity [verbosity] : set the severity/verbosity for the logger.\n"
00082 "    Choices are: debug, trace, routine, warning, error, and fatal.\n"
00083 "  --label [label] : use [label] as prefix for root output file name.\n"
00084 "\n"
00085 "Example usage:\n"
00086 "orcaroot run194ecpu\n"
00087 "  Rootify local file run194ecpu with default verbosity, output file label, etc.\n"
00088 "orcaroot run*\n"
00089 "  Same as before, but run over all files beginning with \"run\".\n"
00090 "orcaroot --verbosity debug --label mylabel run194ecpu\n"
00091 "  The same, but with example usage of the verbosity and mylabel options.\n"
00092 "  An output file will be created with name mylabel_run194.root, and lots\n"
00093 "  of debugging output will appear.\n"
00094 "orcaroot 128.95.100.213:44666\n"
00095 "  Rootify orca stream on host 128.95.100.213, port 44666 with default verbosity,\n"
00096 "  output file label, etc.\n"
00097 "\n"
00098 "\n";
00099

00101 int main(int argc, char** argv)
00102 {
00103   //printf("DEBUG version for KATRIN ipe crate and uw crate -tb-\n");

00105   if(argc == 1) {
00106     ORLog(kError) << "You must supply some options" << endl << Usage;
00107     return 1;
00108   }

00111   static struct option longOptions[] = {
00112     {"help", no_argument, 0, 'h'},
00113     {"verbosity", required_argument, 0, 'v'},
00114     {"label", required_argument, 0, 'l'},
00115   };
00116 
00117   string label = "OR";

00121   while(1) {
00122     char optId = getopt_long(argc, argv, "", longOptions, NULL);
00123     if(optId == -1) break;
00124     switch(optId) {
00125       case('h'): // help
00126         cout << Usage;
00127         return 0;
00128       case('v'): // verbosity
00129         if(strcmp(optarg, "debug") == 0) ORLogger::SetSeverity(ORLogger::kDebug);
00130         else if(strcmp(optarg, "trace") == 0) ORLogger::SetSeverity(ORLogger::kTrace);
00131         else if(strcmp(optarg, "routine") == 0) ORLogger::SetSeverity(ORLogger::kRoutine);
00132         else if(strcmp(optarg, "warning") == 0) ORLogger::SetSeverity(ORLogger::kWarning);
00133         else if(strcmp(optarg, "error") == 0) ORLogger::SetSeverity(ORLogger::kError);
00134         else if(strcmp(optarg, "fatal") == 0) ORLogger::SetSeverity(ORLogger::kFatal);
00135         else {
00136           ORLog(kWarning) << "Unknown verbosity setting " << optarg 
00137                           << "; using kRoutine" << endl;
00138           ORLogger::SetSeverity(ORLogger::kRoutine);
00139         }
00140         break;
00141       case('l'): // label
00142         label = optarg;
00143         break;
00144       default: // unrecognized option
00145         ORLog(kError) << Usage;
00146         return 1;

00148   }

00187     reader = new ORSocketReader(readerArg.substr(0, iColon).c_str(),
